name: HTML
desc: Hypertext Markup Language, is a markup language for the web that defines the structure of web pages.

name: CSS
desc: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

name: JavaScript
desc: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight interpreted (or just-in-time compiled) programming language with first-class functions.

name: PHP
desc: PHP is a widely-used open source general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for web.

name: Bootstrap
desc: Bootstrap is the most popular CSS Framework for developing responsive and mobile-first websites.

name: Tailwindcss
desc: A utility-first CSS framework packed with classes

name: React.js
desc: The React.js framework is an open-source JavaScript framework and library developed by Facebook.

name: Vue.js
desc: Vue is a JavaScript framework that facilitates the UI (user interface) development of websites and single-page applications.

name: Next.js
desc: Next. js is a React framework for building full-stack web applications.

name: Node.js
desc: Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

name: Express.js
desc: Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

name: Laravel
desc: Laravel is a web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax.

name: Livewire
desc: Livewire is a fullstack framework that simplifies the complexity that Vue or React brings up.

name: MySQL
desc: MySQL is a relational database management system based on SQL – Structured Query Language.

name: Figma
desc: Figma is the leading collaborative design tool for building meaningful products.
